{"metadata":{"objective":"Answering the rebuttal","lastStepAudioPath":""},"steps":[{"headerText":"The school board responds","leftText":"<p><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\"><strong>You are</strong></span> voting in a city-wide referendum about a school board proposal to have kids go to school all year round.&nbsp; You have reviewed the school board&#39;s argument and evidence, and the opponents&#39; rebuttal<strong>.&nbsp; </strong><br /><br />Now the school board has<strong> countered</strong> or <strong>argued against</strong> the opponents&#39; rebuttal.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\"><strong>Your next step</strong></span> is to understand what makes a good counter-rebuttal, and then review what the school board has to say.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\"><strong>Try it!</strong></span><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"2\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\"><tbody><tr><td><p><strong>Year-round school proposal</strong></p><p>The school board proposes that kids go to school year-round because year-round school educates students more effectively.<br /><br />Some community members disagree!</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","settings":{"showHeader":1,"showAudio":1,"audioPath":"","hideRightPanel":0,"showNext":1,"delayStep":"0","delayRight":"0","showRFB":0}},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>A <strong>counter-rebuttal</strong> attacks the rebuttal and <ins style=\"text-decoration:underline;\">supports</ins> the argument.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><img alt=\"A diagram shows three stages of an argument: the argument, the rebuttal, and the counter-rebuttal.   In the argument stage, the school board makes its argument.  In the rebuttal stage, the opponents attack the argument. In the counter-rebuttal stage, the school board attacks the rebuttal and supports the argument.  This mini-lesson is about the counter-rebuttal stage in which the school board attacks the opponents' rebuttal and provides more support for its own argument.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":"How do you counter a rebuttal?"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>Here are three strategies you can use to counter a rebuttal:<br />&nbsp;</p><ul style=\"padding-left: 15px;\"><li>If the rebuttal is based on <strong>facts or data</strong>, point out flaws or gaps in the information.<br />&nbsp;</li><li>If the rebuttal is based on <strong>logic</strong>, attack the logic.<br />&nbsp;</li><li>If the rebuttal is based on <strong>expert opinion</strong>, try to discredit it.</li></ul><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":""},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":1,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>Person A and Person B are having an argument about providing aid to struggling countries.&nbsp; Person A proposes that the United States should be generous with foreign aid.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Person A&#39;s factual evidence:&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">Foreign aid to struggling countries has greater benefits than costs because it increases a poor country&#39;s standard of living.&nbsp; According to the United Nations, even small improvements in a country&#39;s infrastructure can greatly increase its economic growth and standard of living. </span></p><p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Person B&#39;s rebuttal:&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">Too many infrastructure projects, like those in central Africa, have failed to improve the nation&#39;s standard of living.</span></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>How would you counter Person B&#39;s rebuttal by challenging the <strong>facts</strong>?</p><p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_38765d0c-f3ba-d68e-e6bb-7ce57c2abf9d\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\">MC Placeholder<br /><strong>ID: mc_3876...</strong></jumc><span>&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>","rightText":null,"headerText":""},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":1,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Person A&#39;s logical evidence:&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">Over the past 10 years, countries with the lowest standard of living have consistently had the highest rate of civil unrest.&nbsp; By sending aid, we stabilize the political situation and save thousands of lives.</span></p><p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Person B&#39;s rebuttal:&nbsp; </span></p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">Unfortunately, the money that we send to foreign countries is often stolen by dictators and mercenaries, who then use the money to further their repressive political military regimes.</span></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>How would you counter Person B&#39;s rebuttal by challenging its <strong>logic</strong>?</p><p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_5d4f6928-704a-846f-b2c4-8a55a80c7bf2\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\">MC Placeholder<br /><strong>ID: mc_5d4f...</strong></jumc><span>&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":1,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Person A&#39;s expert opinion:&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">Studies have shown that improving access to clean water strongly decreases rates of infant mortality.</span><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\"> </span></p><p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Person B&#39;s rebuttal:&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">According to Dr. Lenore Hartman of the Centers for Disease Control, rates of infant mortality have many causes that cannot be eliminated simply by sending foreign aid.&nbsp;</span></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>How would you counter Person B&#39;s rebuttal by challenging or discrediting the <strong>expert opinion</strong>?</p><p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_d098d0e0-fcba-ace7-4c0d-837e5774fc74\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\">MC Placeholder<br /><strong>ID: mc_d098...</strong></jumc><span>&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>Regarding the proposal to extend the school year, the school board&#39;s first counter is to challenge the opponents&#39; facts.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">From the school board&#39;s argument:</span></p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">Students do better on international tests of academic achievement in countries where the school year is longer.&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;</p><p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">From the opponents&#39; rebuttal:</span></p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">Numerous studies of U.S. schools have shown no academic improvement from year-round schooling.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"How does the school board answer the opponents' rebuttal?"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>Which counter-rebuttal can the school board use to challenge the opponents&#39; facts?</p><p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_0e4a1ebe-7d00-193e-4ad1-5aa96e1d4e38\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\">MC Placeholder<br /><strong>ID: mc_0e4a...</strong></jumc><span>&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>","rightText":null,"headerText":""},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":1,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>Next, the school board attacks the opponents&#39; logic.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">From the school board&#39;s argument:</span></p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">Working parents have to make arrangements for childcare during the summer and during long vacations.&nbsp; This is an expensive proposition.&nbsp; Having children in school all year would avoid expense and logistical issues.</span></p><p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">From the opponents&#39; rebuttal:</span></p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">More frequent short breaks throughout the year would make childcare harder to arrange.</span></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>Which counter-rebuttal can the school board use to argue with the opponents&#39; logic?</p><p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_bc64b663-bc5f-f654-8a53-919fb4c11de2\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\">MC Placeholder<br /><strong>ID: mc_bc64...</strong></jumc><span>&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":1,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>The school board comes up with a way to either challenge or discredit the opponents&#39; expert opinions.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">From the school board&#39;s argument:</span></p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">According to experts like Dr. Michaela Smith, numerous studies have shown that students lose educational gains over the summer and must spend valuable time each fall recovering what they have lost.</span></p><p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">From the opponents&#39; rebuttal:</span></p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">Other experts such as Dr. Seth Gershenson have found that a longer school year primarily benefits strong students, not those who are likely to lose educational gains during the summer.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>Which counter-rebuttal can the school board use to rebut the opponents&#39; expert opinions?</p><p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_b53c9d2a-c9f5-6e5c-999a-b21db6173497\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\">MC Placeholder<br /><strong>ID: mc_b53c...</strong></jumc><span>&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":1,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>Finally, the school board counters the rebuttal of their reason.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">From the school board&#39;s argument:</span></p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">Year-round school provides a more effective educational experience.</span></p><p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">From the opponents&#39; rebuttal:</span></p><p style=\"margin-left: 40px;\"><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">School is not the only place where students learn and develop.&nbsp; Unstructured time to play and explore increases creativity and problem-solving skills.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>Which counter-rebuttal can the school board use to rebut the opponents&#39; attack on the school board&#39;s reason?<br /><br /><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_5b866f01-602f-41f2-8433-9fe19b039b2c\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\">MC Placeholder<br /><strong>ID: mc_5b86...</strong></jumc><span>&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>An effective counter-rebuttal addresses as many weaknesses in the rebuttal as possible.&nbsp; It is possible to challenge the rebuttal&#39;s facts, logic, or expert opinion, or any other ways the rebuttal is weak.</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"2\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">The school board&#39;s counter-rebuttal:</span><br /><br />Most of the studies on year-round schooling in U.S. schools were conducted in the 1990s and their conclusions are no longer applicable.&nbsp; In countries where year-round schooling is the norm, childcare for frequent and short breaks in the school year is available. &nbsp;Dr. Seth Gershenson&rsquo;s research actually did show some benefit for students who struggle academically.&nbsp; Creativity can be a part of the school day and many kids&rsquo; time is over-structured because of after school activities, not because of school.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","headerText":"Putting it all together"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-powertip\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">Tip!</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Most arguments do not take place in a courtroom.&nbsp; A community controversy like this one illustrates the process of making an argument and defending it.&nbsp; So, when you make an argument, think about how another person could rebut what you are arguing.&nbsp; Answering this person with an effective counter-rebuttal will make your whole argument stronger. &nbsp;</td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null}],"overviewHeader":"Overview","inputData":{"mc_38765d0c-f3ba-d68e-e6bb-7ce57c2abf9d":{"displayType":"MC","noOfChoices":3,"selectdTry":2,"selectedColumn":1,"choices":[{"text":"Infrastructure projects generally involve building a stable network of buildings, roads, bridges, and transportation.","fixed":false,"incFeedback":"This statement is a definition; Aid in the form of vaccines, medical supplies, fresh water, and food can and does benefit the people who live in developing countries.","fixed":false,"incFeedback":""},{"fixed":false,"text":"Journalists have made it seem that all poor countries are led by dictators who steal foreign aid and build huge mansions for themselves, but I think the journalists have a hidden agenda.","incFeedback":"This is an opinion and does not attack the logic of the rebuttal."},{"fixed":false},{"fixed":false}],"selectedTry":2,"correct":1,"correctFeedback":"This is a good answer to the rebuttal. It does not attack Mr. Smith's character.  Which statement argues against a person rather than an argument?"},{"fixed":false,"text":"Teresa Jenkins, who has been studying compensation patterns in the United States for more than twenty years, is a reliable expert on compensation issues.","incFeedback":"This is not an <i>ad hominem</i> argument; to the contrary, it praises Teresa Jenkins."},{"fixed":false},{"fixed":false}],"selectedTry":2,"correct":0,"correctFeedback":"This statement attacks Ms. Landis rather than advancing or rebutting the argument."},"mc_bc64b663-bc5f-f654-8a53-919fb4c11de2":{"displayType":"MC","noOfChoices":3,"selectdTry":2,"selectedColumn":1,"choices":[{"text":"In countries where year-round schooling is the norm, this type of childcare is available.","fixed":false},{"text":"Any kind of childcare is expensive.","fixed":false,"incFeedback":""},{"fixed":false,"incFeedback":"","text":"The quality of childcare is not consistent across the country.."},{"fixed":false},{"fixed":false}],"selectedTry":2,"correct":0,"correctFeedback":"This counter-rebuttal makes the logical point that if the school schedule changes, the availability of childcare will change with it.","incorrectFeedback":"This does not address the issue of the logistical challenges associated with arranging this kind of childcare."},"mc_b53c9d2a-c9f5-6e5c-999a-b21db6173497":{"displayType":"MC","noOfChoices":3,"selectdTry":2,"selectedColumn":1,"choices":[{"text":"Yes, but Dr. Gershenson’s research did show some benefit for students who struggle academically.","fixed":false},{"text":"It always takes my children at least a month to refocus on school after a long vacation.","fixed":false,"incFeedback":"This is personal experience. It is not an acceptable counter-rebuttal."},{"fixed":false,"text":"According to the president of the local Little League team, players who attend tutoring sessions throughout the summer seem to get better grades in the fall.","incFeedback":"The president of the local Little League team is not an expert on educational issues."},{"fixed":false},{"fixed":false}],"selectedTry":2,"correct":0,"correctFeedback":"This statement demonstrates that the rebuttal did not include all the findings of Dr. Gershenson's research."},"mc_0e4a1ebe-7d00-193e-4ad1-5aa96e1d4e38":{"displayType":"MC","noOfChoices":3,"selectdTry":2,"selectedColumn":1,"choices":[{"text":"Most of the studies on year-round schooling in U.S. schools were conducted in the 1990s and their conclusions are no longer applicable.","fixed":false},{"text":"The problem is that many students who are struggling academically don’t respond well to current teaching methods or have challenging home situations.  None of that will change if we extend the school year.","fixed":false,"incFeedback":"This is not challenging the facts of the rebuttal."},{"fixed":false,"text":"The teachers in our public school system do not earn enough money.  By extending the school year, we can finally justify giving them a large raise and paying them the money that they deserve.","incFeedback":"This is an opinion that does not challenge the facts of the rebuttal."},{"fixed":false},{"fixed":false}],"selectedTry":2,"correct":0,"correctFeedback":"This is a strong counter-rebuttal because it discredits the validity of the studies cited by the opponents to the year-round schooling proposal."},"mc_5b866f01-602f-41f2-8433-9fe19b039b2c":{"displayType":"MC","noOfChoices":3,"selectdTry":2,"selectedColumn":1,"choices":[{"text":"Creativity and problem-solving can be a part of the school day and many kids’ time is over-structured because of after school activities, not because of school.","fixed":false,"correct":false},{"text":"My children use unstructured time to play video games.  This is not developing their creativity and problem-solving skills.","fixed":false,"correct":false,"incFeedback":"This is a personal opinion.  It is not an effective counter-rebuttal."},{"fixed":false,"correct":false,"text":"Some successful adults lack both independence and creativity.","incFeedback":"This statement does not address the value of unstructured time."},{"fixed":false,"correct":false},{"fixed":false,"correct":false}],"selectedTry":2,"correct":0,"correctFeedback":"This statement points out that the school day can provide some of the same benefits to students as unstructured time, and that there are other ways to provide kids with more unstructured time.","incorrectFeedback":""}},"rightFloatText":"<table border=\"2\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-cktitle\" style=\"color:#025B5B;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:22px;font-weight:bold;\">Year-round school</span><br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">The opponents&#39; rebuttal:</span><br /><br />Numerous studies of U.S. schools have shown no academic improvement from year-round schooling.&nbsp; In addition, more frequent short breaks throughout the year would make childcare harder to arrange.&nbsp; Experts such as Dr. Seth Gershenson have found that a longer school year primarily benefits strong students, not those who are likely to lose educational gains during the summer.&nbsp; Finally, school is not the only place where students learn and develop.&nbsp; Unstructured time to play and explore increases creativity and problem-solving skills.</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>"}
